column4: hello everyboody..i have a serious problem with my ubuntu 9.10... whenever i suspend or hibernate my system and when i resumes back .. my system monitor shows 100% CPU usage.... so i have to restart my system to make it normal...plzz help me with this issue...
can you use the "top" command in a terminal to determine what is eating the CPU?
i checked but no help... :(
does top show 100% CPU usage?
hold on i will check again
hey man plzz check this.. top command is showing that 100 %
100 is the CPU usage
ipfm appears to be a bandwidth monitor app - it doesn't seem to be part of base install, could you uninstall it perhaps?
or file a bug against it?
okk i will try that
will get back to u
hii it worked perfectly for me....
cool - you "might" want to post a bug about that program - if you feel generous

hey can u help me in solving one more problem..?? whenever i boot or shutdown my  system i see a line while booting.. "pidfile not found. is jackd running" ... what is that,,, and there it shows a red * in front of that
jack is an audio sub-system of some sort - i've never used it sorry
what is a pidfile ...??
pidfile is a recording of what PID (process ID) a particular program is running with - it's saying no PIDFILE most likely because the program isn't running
i really wouldn't worry too much about it myself
ohkk...
hey man. how did u have soo much knowledge about LINUX.. whats your age.. are u a engineer
hey can i uninstall jackd ..???
? dunno - it's not installed on my system, but perhaps something you did install requires it
